Nova, Max: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs          Special Programs  Nova, Max Adjunct Instructor, Open Arts Email: maxnova@nyu.edu  Courses Live Video Performance Art Biography Max  Nova, a graduate of New York University’s Film and Television program,  currently runs a production company out of Brooklyn entitled, Dawn Of Man . He  won Best Short Film at the 2009 Castle Rock and Estes Park Film Festivals for  his NYU thesis film, The Shaman’s Apprentice, and the 2008 Warner Bros. Post  Production award for his advanced-experimental film, The Bystander Effect.            After  graduating NYU, Nova began developing a career as a video artist, and VJ,  performing a live mix of original video art for events and concerts around the  world. Nova’s video projection art has been featured in galleries such as the  PhotoLA art fair in Santa Monica, and the MoMA in Manhattan.
